message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how to reproduce both of the pictured “arches” exactly from the dictionary blocks (without rotating any block).  I have broken the solution into the three requested parts.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1) ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Overall Count and Layers

  – There are two separate arch‐like structures (left and right).  
  – Together they use a total of 15 blocks.

• Left Structure (7 blocks total)

  1) Bottom layer: one yellow rectangular plank forming the base.  
  2) Above it: two vertical orange cylinders (side by side).  
  3) Above the cylinders: another yellow rectangular plank bridging across.  
  4) On top of that plank: a red arch block (the half‐circle cutout facing front).  
  5) Finally, a peaked “roof” made from two red triangular wedges.

• Right Structure (8 blocks total)

  1) Bottom layer: two red arch blocks side by side (arches facing front).  
  2) Next layer: one yellow rectangular plank bridging those two arches.  
  3) Above that plank: four red quarter‐circle blocks arranged in a ring to form the large circular opening.  
  4) Top layer: another yellow rectangular plank laid across the top.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2) SELECTING THE REQUIRED BLOCKS AND INDICES
────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Matching each shape/color/orientation in the target:

• Red ARCH block (#1) — used 3 times  
  – Once for the top of the left structure  
  – Twice at the base of the right structure

• Red QUARTER‐CIRCLE block (#4) — used 4 times  
  – Forms the circular “window” in the middle of the right‐hand structure

• Yellow RECTANGULAR plank (#5) — used 4 times  
  – Two planks in the left structure (base and top)  
  – Two planks in the right structure (lower beam and upper beam)

• Orange CYLINDER (#10) — used 2 times  
  – The two vertical columns in the left structure

• Red WEDGES (#15 and #16) — one each  
  – They combine to form the triangular roof atop the left structure

Hence the needed block indices and their counts:  
  – #1 × 3  
  – #4 × 4  
  – #5 × 4  
  – #10 × 2  
  – #15 × 1  
  – #16 × 1  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3) STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is one possible order in which to place the blocks:

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 5   (left structure base plank)
  Step2:  Move block with index 10  (first orange cylinder)
  Step3:  Move block with index 10  (second orange cylinder)
  Step4:  Move block with index 5   (top plank over the cylinders)
  Step5:  Move block with index 1   (red arch on top)
  Step6:  Move block with index 15  (first red wedge of the roof)
  Step7:  Move block with index 16  (second red wedge of the roof)

  Step8:  Move block with index 1   (left red arch of the right structure’s base)
  Step9:  Move block with index 1   (right red arch of the right structure’s base)
  Step10: Move block with index 5   (yellow plank bridging over those arches)
  Step11: Move block with index 4   (first quarter‐circle for the circular window)
  Step12: Move block with index 4   (second quarter‐circle)
  Step13: Move block with index 4   (third quarter‐circle)
  Step14: Move block with index 4   (fourth quarter‐circle)
  Step15: Move block with index 5   (final yellow plank across the top)
}

Following these steps with the indicated blocks (exactly as they appear in the dictionary, no rotations) will yield the two structures shown in the target image.
